What we did Working principles

Motivation - Insight #11

People are focused on their own risks

We believe...

People on the ground are often so focused on their own risks that they don’t think to consider wider/strategic risks because they’re busy. It’s hard to see, influence and understand the wider perspective.

Because we've seen and heard...

“100% of my time is risk...it shouldn't be...however we are doing a lot of deep dives at the moment”

There is no way for them to see or find areas of risk within another part of the Co-op

They spend lots of time on manual processes

They see someone else dealing with it: “The central risk team is more big picture” / “Our BP looks at it from a strategic point of view, we are more granular”

User need #2

As a Co-op manager
I need to know what may negatively impact my area
So that I can take steps to reduce the impact

User need #4

As a Co-op manager
I need to be able to see all risks that could impact my areas
So we can take action to reduce the impact and likelihood

User need #8

When I’m managing risk
I need to be able to find and interrogate all the relevant data to me, my area and my role
So that I can improve my understanding and identify patterns

User need #11

When I’m managing risk
I need to be able to identify and record links and interdependencies
So that I can build a clearer picture of the landscape

User need #12

When I’m managing risk

I need help to remember what needs doing and when
So that I can take the right action at the right time
